metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15969 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use after free in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to 86.0.4240.75 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15969` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
